title: Presidential Proclamation on Regulatory Relief for Certain Stationary Sources to Promote American Coke Oven Processing Security
summary: This presidential proclamation announces regulatory relief for certain stationary sources to promote security and resilience in American coke oven processing. It describes the scope of the relief, identifies the affected stationary sources within the coke oven and steel production sectors, and explains the intended purpose to support continuity of essential industrial operations while maintaining safety and environmental standards. The proclamation directs appropriate federal agencies to implement the relief, establish applicable procedures, timelines, and oversight mechanisms, and coordinates with state authorities as needed. It may modify or suspend certain regulatory obligations for eligible sources for a defined period, establishes eligibility criteria and reporting requirements, and emphasizes alignment with national industrial security and economic goals by easing burdens on affected facilities while ensuring oversight and compliance.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for Federal Leadership Positions (ATF Director, EEOC General Counsel, CFPB Director, and More)
summary: The White House released a post announcing nominations to the United States Senate for several federal appointments. The announced nominees include Robert Cekada of Florida to be Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives; Carter Crow of Texas to be General Counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission for a four-year term; Stuart Levenbach of Maryland to be Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection for a five-year term; and David Clay Fowlkes among others. The post indicates that multiple nominations have been submitted for Senate confirmation, covering leadership positions in federal regulatory agencies.

title: Proclamation: National Adoption Month, 2025
summary: Designates November 2025 as National Adoption Month. The proclamation emphasizes that every child deserves a safe and nurturing home and that adoption can provide stability and a sense of belonging for children in need. It acknowledges and commends adoptive families and calls on communities, organizations, and government agencies to support efforts that promote adoption and assist children and families.

title: Executive Order Establishing Policy for Foster Care and Family Support
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under constitutional and statutory authority, establishes the Administration's policy framework for supporting families and enabling parents to raise children in safe environments. It begins with Section 1, Purpose and Policy, which articulates the goal of empowering parents to maintain stable homes for their children and notes the role of foster care in situations where such family arrangements are disrupted by crises. The document outlines how the federal government will address foster care within this policy framework.

title: Proclamation: Anti-Communism Week, 2025
summary: This presidential proclamation designates Anti-Communism Week for 2025. It notes that the nation observes the week as a solemn remembrance of the devastation caused by communist ideologies, stating that across continents and generations, communism has wrought devastation and that more than 100 million lives have been taken by regimes associated with communism. The proclamation encourages reflection on the historical impact of these ideologies.
